injury: shattered glasses, torn brow, eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss, ongoing vertigo
injury_type: eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss
circumstances: Canister shot through closed gate at ICE facility protest
notes: Vincent Hawkins, 55-year-old US citizen ER nurse, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: tear_gas_canister. Injury: shattered glasses, torn brow, eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss, ongoing vertigo. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
outcome: eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss
outcome_detail: eye damage, concussion, partial vision loss
jurisdiction_notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.

circumstances: Reporter shot in head while covering protest
notes: Local journalist (unnamed), US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: rubber_bullet. Injury: head wound, concussion. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.

injury: facial burns, difficulty breathing, hospital treatment
circumstances: Shot while saying 'We come in peace' at waterfront near Coast Guard base; plans lawsuit

jurisdiction_notes: Strong sanctuary policy predating state law. Mayor warned residents of ICE raids 2018.

circumstances: Shot while wearing press badge and carrying cameras

Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions. First of two documented incidents - shot again on Sept 26 (T4-035).
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

circumstances: Narrowly avoided eye injury by inches

circumstances: Officers fired from roof into peaceful crowd; grenade landed nearby; projectile destroyed acoustic guitar

circumstances: First-person video captured agent firing at close range

circumstances: Veterans training recalled involuntarily

injury: projectile penetrated guitar and struck leg
circumstances: Federally charged in October with conspiracy to impede officer

injury: pepper spray, leg laceration from glass, pepper spray burns
circumstances: 25-year-old disabled Iraq veteran and security guard encountered ICE roadblock at cannabis farm. Window smashed, pepper sprayed, dragged out, knee on neck. Held 3 days at MDC LA without charges, attorney access, or family contact. Taking steps to sue via FTCA with Institute for Justice.
notes: George Retes testified before House Oversight Committee. DHS claimed he 'became violent' - Retes disputes this, says he just asked to pass through to work. Separated from non-citizens indicating officers knew he was US citizen. Missed daughter's 3rd birthday.

circumstances: 26-year-old Florida-born construction worker detained twice (May 21 and June 12) at Baldwin County building sites. First time: filmed agents tackling brother, was grabbed, REAL ID dismissed as fake. Second time: confronted alone in house. Filed federal lawsuit Sept 30.
notes: Leonardo Garcia Venegas, born in Florida, lived in Alabama since age 14. Brother was deported. Agents ignored white and Black workers, targeted Latinos. DHS claimed he 'obstructed' arrest. Lawsuit includes 19 similar cases. Judge later swapped for Trump appointee.
jurisdiction_notes: Baldwin County. Alabama is anti-sanctuary (HB 56).

circumstances: Caught during street vendor raid; charged with assaulting officer (charges dismissed); held incommunicado
notes: Andrea Velez, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

circumstances: Day-laborer advocate filming at Home Depot; Border Patrol chief named him on social media with false accusations; no charges filed
notes: Daniel Montenegro, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: back injury from tackle. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act and LAPD Special Order 40.

injury: broken ribs, recent heart surgery patient
circumstances: 79-year-old tackled at car wash; knees pressed into neck/back
notes: Rafie Ollah Shouhed, 79-year-old US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Injury: broken ribs, recent heart surgery patient. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: LA neighborhood. Under California Values Act and LAPD Special Order 40.

circumstances: US citizen detained by Border Patrol in Lincoln Square while walking to work. Tackled to ground, handcuffed, held 7 hours. Released without charges. Pursuing legal action through People's Law Office.
notes: Debbie Brockman, US citizen WGN-TV employee, injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

circumstances: 20-year-old US citizen Walmart worker detained in parking lot after approaching agents questioning elderly coworker. Video shows agents wrestling him to ground. Held at MDC, released on $5,000 bond. Fired by Walmart. Body covered in cuts and bruises.
notes: Adrian Andrew Martinez, 20-year-old US citizen born in Huntington Park. Approached CBP agents in Walmart parking lot after witnessing them use force on elderly Latino janitor. Initially accused of punching agent (no assault charges filed, no video evidence supports claim). Released on bond, fired by Walmart.

circumstances: US citizen child with brain cancer deported with parents and 4 siblings at Sarita checkpoint en route to emergency medical appointment in Houston
notes: Family traveling from Rio Grande City to Houston for daughter's brain cancer treatment. Detained Feb 3 at Sarita checkpoint (Kenedy County), held overnight at Donna Processing Center, deported to Mexico Feb 4. Five of six children are US citizens. Family had previously passed checkpoint with physician's letter.
outcome_detail: US citizen children deported to Mexico

circumstances: Driving wife to work with 1-year-old daughter; ICE agent applied prohibited carotid restraint (thumbs on arteries). DHS policy prohibits this except when deadly force justified. Filed ACLU lawsuit.
notes: Carlos Zapata Rivera, injured by less-lethal force. Weapon: carotid_restraint. Injury: loss of consciousness, seizure-like movements. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: Under Massachusetts SJC ruling that detainers are not legally binding.

circumstances: 30-year resident; pepper-sprayed while observing enforcement. Named plaintiff in Tincher v. Noem class action.
notes: Susan Tincher, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

circumstances: Followed home by unmarked cars; named plaintiff in class action.
notes: John Biestman, US citizen injured by less-lethal force. Part of documented pattern of excessive force against protesters and bystanders at ICE enforcement actions.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

notes: George and Esmeralda Doilez, US citizens who voted for Trump twice, were detained by masked Border Patrol agents while scouting campsites. Agents claimed they were looking for a 'known alien' in area. K-9 found legal cannabis, agents searched car. George asked 'Because we're not white?' Couple now regrets voting for Trump. Esmeralda feared agents might kill George.

Joe Botello, 37, Texas-born US citizen, was awakened at 5:30am when ICE agents broke through his door during raid led personally by DHS Secretary Kristi Noem. Handcuffed and led out. Released after scanning his driver's license. Noem shared video on social media showing Botello handcuffed without noting he was a US citizen. Part of Operation Midway Blitz. Chicago Tribune demanded Noem apologize.
jurisdiction_notes: Chicago suburb under Illinois TRUST Act.

notes: Maria Greeley, 44, US citizen born at Illinois Masonic Hospital, was surrounded by 3 masked ICE agents on her way home from work. Zip-tied and interrogated for 1 hour despite having US passport. Agents said she 'doesn't look like' a Greeley and called her a liar. Congressman Krishnamoorthi called for accountability.
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

injury: chokehold, bruised neck, trauma unit hospitalization
notes: Arnoldo Bazan, 16-year-old US citizen, was put in chokehold by ICE agents while they detained his father on way to school. Agent put knee on father's neck. Arnoldo couldn't breathe. Hospitalized at Texas Children's Hospital trauma unit with neck bruises. Father deported to Mexico. Phone confiscated and later found at electronics vending machine near ICE detention center. ProPublica documented this as one of 40+ cases of banned chokeholds.
jurisdiction_notes: Complies with SB4. Large immigrant population.

outcome: ACLU and human rights groups demand facility closure
outcome_detail: December 8, 2025, ACLU and human rights groups sent letter to ICE demanding end to detention at Camp East Montana. Letter details accounts from 45+ interviewed detainees including 16 sworn declarations documenting: beatings and sexual abuse by officers, beatings and coercive threats to compel deportation to third countries, medical neglect, hunger, denial of counsel access.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Detained teenager 'Samuel' told lawyers he was beaten so severely he sustained injuries across body, lost consciousness, taken to hospital by ambulance. Another detainee: 'slammed against the ground, handcuffed, taken outside for stepping out of line in the dining hall' with guards nearly breaking his wrists. Opened August 2025 despite warnings. Former Japanese internment site. 60+ federal standard violations in first 50 days. 2,700+ detainees - largest center. DHS disputed claims but Senator Ossoff investigation received 510 credible reports of abuse across 25 states.
source_name: ACLU / Human Rights Watch / Senator Ossoff Investigation

outcome: Ended 17-day hunger strike after ICE assured not on deportation list
outcome_detail: Pedro Lorenzo Concepcion began hunger strike July 22, 2025, two weeks after entering 'Alligator Alcatraz.' Detained July 9 when voluntarily appeared at ICE Miramar for routine check despite compliance. Transferred to Krome in retaliation. Despite 2-week strike, Krome wouldn't recognize him as striker until he rejected 9 consecutive meals. Ended strike after 17 days (August 8) when ICE assured him he wasn't on deportation list. Extremely weakened, could barely walk.
notes: EXHAUSTIVE: Alligator Alcatraz conditions per Amnesty International: Lights on 24/7, overflowing toilets, no shower access, solitary in 2x2 foot boxes, people shackled in 2-foot-high metal cages left outside without water for up to a day, denial of potable water, meals with maggots, oversized mosquitoes. Amnesty: 'amount to torture or other ill-treatment.' Built in 8 days in June 2025 on remote Everglades airfield. 34 no-bid contracts totaling $360+ million. Only 31% of detainees had final orders despite DeSantis claims. Environmental groups won preliminary injunction.

US citizen stepbrothers (Godinez born in California, Napoles born in Roxboro, NC) pulled over while recovering coworkers vehicle. Officers allegedly punched them in abdomens, attempted to drag them from vehicle. Incident recorded on video viewed millions of times. Released after ~30 minutes when citizenship confirmed.
jurisdiction_notes: Rowan County. North Carolina varies by county; Rowan is cooperative.

notes: US citizen Coast Guard veteran detained on Carnival cruise ship. Border Patrol agents entered cabin at 6:45 AM, handcuffed him in front of wife. Held 1.5 hours in concrete cell at Port of Miami. Detained due to common Hispanic name matching drug trafficking warrants. Released without apology.
jurisdiction_notes: Ended sanctuary policy 2017 after state law.

notes: US citizen (born in Laurel, MD hospital) with dual Mexican citizenship. Arrested heading home from Taco Bell. Sister shouted she was born in US but agents ignored. ICE disputed citizenship despite birth certificate. Detained 25 days. Federal judge prohibited deportation Dec 18, released Jan 7, 2026.
jurisdiction_notes: Prince George's County. Under Maryland TRUST Act.

notes: Hugo Monteiro, 31, naturalized US citizen since 2020, originally from Brazil. Works in Revere. Was accompanying client to Cambridge District Court in Medford on May 16, 2025. Four CBP officers handcuffed him at 9:15am, put in car. Released ~9:30am when mistake realized. Monteiro said he still supports Trump: 'Unfortunately, they called the wrong person, but I still support whatever they're doing.'
jurisdiction_notes: Under Massachusetts SJC ruling. Boston metro area.

notes: US citizen (born in West Palm Beach). 18-year-old dragged from van, pushed to pavement. Officer told him: You got no rights here. Coworker tasered. Video recorded encounter. Detained 6 hours, charges later dropped.
jurisdiction_notes: Palm Beach County. Florida requires full ICE cooperation.

victim_name: Romeo, Ruby, and Jade (US citizen children)
notes: Three US citizen children (all born in Louisiana) DEPORTED to Honduras. Romeo (4yo) has Stage 4 kidney cancer, deported without medication. Ruby is 7yo sister. Jade is 2yo from different family. Parents coerced under threat children would go to foster care.
outcome_detail: US citizen children deported to Honduras
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated but Louisiana is anti-sanctuary state. City has historically limited cooperation but constrained by state law.

notes: US citizen (derivative citizenship through father). Born in Thai refugee camp, entered US as infant. Federal judge issued TRO Oct 23 prohibiting removal. ICE deported him to Laos anyway in violation of court order.
outcome_detail: deported to Laos despite federal court order

notes: 5-year-old US CITIZEN deported to Honduras with mother. Family held incommunicado in San Antonio hotel. Deported within one week with no access to attorney or judge. Child is US citizen by birth.
outcome_detail: US citizen child deported to Honduras
jurisdiction_notes: Historically immigrant-friendly but constrained by TX SB4. APD contacted ICE 33 times Jan-Sept 2025. Chief Davis: 'to me, means it's a sanctuary city' but cannot prohibit ICE contact.

notes: 20-year-old US CITIZEN detained and fingerprinted despite repeatedly stating "I am a citizen." Named plaintiff in ACLU class action lawsuit alleging ICE/CBP conducting suspicionless stops targeting Somali and Latino communities.
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.
